function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Difficulty in long-term planning for climate change impact on health in resource-limited settings","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incentivizing effective adaptation policies in the absence of visible threats","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty and ambiguity in epidemiological trends and impact of prevention efforts","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of social science integration in disease control policies and programs","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of integration with policymakers and practitioners","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Focus on single diseases in surveillance systems","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overlapping transmission of multiple parasitic or viral diseases by the same species of mosquito.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Compartmentalized disease surveillance and reporting systems with fragmented international networks.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited attention to the pervasive co-infection in neglected tropical diseases ntds .","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited investigation of potential interactions between people and triatomine bugs in different landscape fragments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumption of homogeneity in social representations and practices of people in geographic, cultural, and economic landscapes","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Validation of results between disciplinary teams suggests potential biases and lack of alternative perspectives","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to consider interactions between distinct pathogens in a common host","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of climate change projections in describing the risk of multiple vector-borne diseases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Heavy focus on pharmacological interventions and limited attention to environmental management at the community level","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clean water and sanitation leading to the presence of intestinal parasitic diseases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of co-infection in disease control and epidemiological modeling","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underfunded health systems and ineffective health governance structures","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Atypical climatic variations leading to rift valley fever and malaria epidemics in east africa","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weak community-level outreach systems for public health","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of surveillance and monitoring of disease status at the community level","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of reporting on coinfection and co-morbidity in existing disease distribution systems","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of detail in existing hdss data due to lack of extensive laboratory assessment","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Performance scrutiny and contextual factors influencing community health workers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Widespread use of community volunteers without financial support","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Normalization of existing disease patterns and organizational methods","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate community participation and empowerment","category":"Social and cultural risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited examples of institutionalizing participatory approaches in developing countries with limited resources and weak institutional support.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inequalities at the local level and gatekeepers silencing community groups from participating and having a voice.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long-term collaboration and stakeholder engagement required for successful disease mitigation initiatives.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Primary health care networks as an organizational base","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of drug resistance","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intensive educational program emphasizing prevention and curative medicine","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local ecological factors driving site-specific interventions may not be scalable and applicable in different regions, leading to ineffective disease control measures.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of community awareness about the relationships between vector-borne diseases vbds and social, environmental, and climatic determinants may hinder the effectiveness of community-based interventions.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The lack of national ownership and government-driven initiatives may hinder the effective scale-up of disease control efforts, leading to limited impact at a national level.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differential impact on different social groups due to vbds transmission","category":"Social and cultural risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to government outreach programs and socio-economic development opportunities for women","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerable children under 5 and pregnant women at heightened risk of vbds","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Barriers to vbd prevention, treatment, and control in tribal communities due to geographic, cultural, and social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Marginalization of community participation in global malaria efforts","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of artemisinin-resistant malaria among mobile and migrant populations in cambodia","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Stigmatization of vulnerable social groups in malaria interventions","category":"Social and cultural risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local perceptions and cultural norms may influence the acceptability and adaptability of program tools for disease control.","category":"Social and cultural risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Over-reliance on one or two disease control tools may lead to ineffective and unsustainable disease control
